intro: Calawaya caquetana, commonly known as the Andean wax tree, is a species of flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stem and broad, waxy leaves that help reduce water loss in its arid environment. Calawaya caquetana produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom during the warmer months. It is often used in traditional medicine and is valued for its ecological role in stabilizing soil in mountainous regions.
